This was amazing! You are in a beautiful redwood grove with a radiant, nude yogini for a full hour. Her guiding voice is as soothing and relaxing as she is wonderful to watch. This is obviously a very experienced yoga practitioner and she flows gracefully from one pose to the next. Some of the poses look quite challenging, but she eases into them with good breathing and with grace. The music and zen quotes that come up now and then are unobtrusive, peaceful and serene. You even hear birds chirping quietly in the background once in awhile. Highly recommend if you enjoy a relaxing, instructional and highly aesthetic yoga experience.

Exactly what Ive been looking for! Real yoga teacher, doing real yoga, with real instruction. And she has a hot super toned tight yoga body. Watching her nude is helpful and totally inspiring. Choice camera angles and revealing close-ups so I can really see what shes doing. The pacing and poses are easy. Challenging enough if Im up for a challenge. As far as instructional voices go- her instructional voice was very helpful and very listenable, not intrusive. I even thought the redwood forest s was an inspired choice for the slow yoga pace.. All in all, I find that out of the many yoga DVDs I own, this is the one I keep going back to. Good enough that sometimes I just load it up and watch it to relax. Definitely my new favorite.

First, the voice is very annoying. Breathy, phony, valley-girl. Second, the DVD is not arranged to be followed as a yoga class. A good instructional yoga video starts with warm-ups, progresses to stretches, and then builds from there. Typically the focus or a yoga video is easy, intermediate, or advanced. This DVD does not do that. It intersperses poses without any instructional connection.

Pure Nude Yoga is a revelation. A great introduction to yoga with a healthy sense for the sensual. As I've always said, we have collectively allowed ourselves to lose touch with our basic roots to nature. Here is a healthy part of the solution.

I have viewed many of the works by Dane van Rose in this subject area.  The Yoga is executed well.  The time per pose and the transitions are well done.  The setting was nice - not exactly what I hoped for when I saw the title but then "the eyes of the mind always see wider."  While Mr. van Rose's other titles are exceptional and should be purchased by all who believe as I do that Yoga, when practiced in the natural, is a compelling, cleansing and especially invigorating experience; I would set this one aside for one reason - soundtrack.  The music and format is exactly what I expected but the speaking was distracting even disturbing and annoying.  The speakers voice is not what I would call compelling for subject but what is said is adulterated with 60s and 70s neo-Buddhist poppycock.  If a person must speak in a video such as this limiting it and keeping it simply to what helps execution of the poses should be a guideline. 5 stars for quality, 4 for the yoga, 3 for setting and 0 for narration.  Sorry, Mr. van Rose you have set the bar so high...
